_metadata.description: Project intelligence: market context, subsidiary business models, energy tariff benchmarks, capex benchmarks, sales pipeline, scraping targets
sources: Qdrant vector DB collection: nwl_lanseria_8433 (2066 chunks, 170+ documents)
Excel files: Bear Solar models, TWX pipeline, Phoenix guarantor summary
Chapter documents from NWL Project Details folder
_metadata.extraction_method: Vector DB queries + direct Excel file reading via openpyxl

sewage_treatment.description: 39% of SA's wastewater treatment plants in critical condition, 20-30% classified as poor

water_supply.description: 29% of water supply systems in critical condition

municipal_infrastructure.description: Municipalities spend 2% vs 8% recommended on infrastructure maintenance

power_crisis.electricity_cost_ppp: PPP-adjusted costs on par with Sweden/EU despite chronic load shedding
power_crisis.honeysucker_cost: R1,000/kL (orders of magnitude higher than piped)

technology.mabr_vs_cas: 75% lower energy usage than conventional CAS

business_model.description: Solar + BESS resilience for NWL operations, novated to specialist utility LanRED
business_model.grid_connection: Lanseria airport substation (must-run, no load shedding)
business_model.arbitrage_strategy: Day-night tariff arbitrage, load shedding mitigation
business_model.reference_doc: Chapter 5.1: Solar Resilience & Arbitrage – The LanRED Strategy

sa_solar_bess_benchmarks.description: South African C&I solar PV and BESS installed cost benchmarks (2024/25)

solar_pv_ci.note: C&I ground-mount/rooftop, 1-5 MWp, fully installed EPC turnkey. Includes modules, inverters, BOS, civil, commissioning.
solar_pv_ci.position: Mid-range — conservative for European EPC (DG&E), competitive for local SA installer

bess_li_ion_ci.note: C&I Li-ion BESS, 1-5 MWh, fully installed. Includes battery packs, BMS, inverter, enclosure, commissioning.
bess_li_ion_ci.position: Low-mid — reflects aggressive BESS pricing trend and reduced allocation

capacity_factor_gauteng.note: Gauteng GHI ~2000 kWh/m²/yr. Fixed-tilt 21.5% CF = 1,885 kWh/kWp/yr — upper-mid for region.

eskom_tou_tariffs.source: Eskom Homeflex TOU (verified from ecoflow.com, biznews.com)
eskom_tou_tariffs.note: Homeflex rates used as ceiling benchmark (residential). Megaflex (C&I) energy charges typically 50-70% of Homeflex but include separate demand charges (R/kVA). Exact Megaflex rates in PDF: eskom.co.za/distribution/tariffs-and-charges/

bess_2cycle_arbitrage.description: 2-cycle daily BESS arbitrage: Cycle 1 (grid off-peak → peak) + Cycle 2 (own solar → peak)

cycle_1_grid_to_peak.ld_spread_note: R2.00 × 85% - R1.59 = R0.11 (barely profitable, skip in LD)

cycle_parameters.breakdown: HD: 91 days × 2 cycles = 182; LD: 274 days × 1 cycle = 274 (skip LD cycle 1)

degradation_at_456_cycles.note: Industry benchmark: 2% at 260 cycles, 3% at ~450 cycles, 4% at 730 cycles. Linear interpolation.

bess_2cycle_arbitrage.note: Net revenue after charging costs and RT efficiency losses. LanRED must-run substation means resilience value is lower — pure arbitrage play.

ppa_rates_sa.note: LanRED uses IC pricing (Eskom -10%) not competitive IPP rates. Premium justified by: grid resilience, firm capacity (BESS), IC transfer pricing.

om_benchmarks.note: Industry standard ~1% of CapEx for fixed O&M. Variable covers cleaning, minor repairs.

sources: SAPVIA (SA PV Industry Association) market reports
SA IPP Office C&I market data

bear_solar_benchmark.description: Project Bear BOQ - Botswana reference project for capex benchmarking
bear_solar_benchmark.source_file: context/solar inspiration/Botswana Bear Solar Farm Financial Model V1 Flat Rate PPA REV4_3.xlsm
bear_solar_benchmark.reference_doc: context/solar inspiration/Project Bear Prelim BOQ V3.docx

general.structural_timber: Treated for long service life (100+ years when detailed properly)

phase_1.description: Asset rental model with Greenblocks JV

phase_2.description: Buy Optimat panel machines - THIS APPLICATION

phase_3.addressable_market: 15,000 houses at R1M each with 40% Finnish content

projects.name: Limbro Park Development
projects.notes: Large blocks of flats, multiple modular units. DBSA financing in place but bankability work required.

projects.name: NBI Youth Development Centres
projects.notes: 5 buildings at different sites. Sole-sourced to Werner due to technical capability. KfW funding allocated.

projects.name: Low Cost Houses - Langa
projects.notes: Project driven by University of Pretoria. Transport to Cape Town is a risk.

projects.name: Garden Route Projects
projects.notes: Green Block secured projects with approved plans. Transport cost ~R50k per super link trip.

greenblocks.role: Execution partner for erect + finish + pipeline

finland_timber_mills.rationale: Better quality = less timber needed. Including transport still cheaper due to economies of scale SA can't compete with

dge_epc.role: EPC JV for SA office and sales channels

smart_city_lanseria.role: Partnership for zoned land + turnkey houses + finance envelope
smart_city_lanseria.integration: Can offer complete package to buyers

ancillary_jvs.bathroom_manufacturers: Plug and play bathrooms from Finland

epcf_model.description: EPC Finance wrapper - client buys turnkey + financed houses from established EPC
flow: EPC hires TWX to convert to pre-fab
EPC hires contractor (Greenblocks) to erect and finish on-site
client_benefits: Pre-sales can start prior to repayments
Higher and predictable quality (thanks to TWX)
EPCF allows lower interest rates and higher leverage
Client focuses on sales instead of building and funding

coe_center_of_excellence.description: Watercare Center of Excellence for SETA-accredited training

sale_to_llc.description: CoE sold to LLC in Year 4 at 10% premium to purchase price. Stops rental income stream.
sale_to_llc.note: Mention in NWL that rental swaps to LLC ownership after sale

coe_center_of_excellence.reference_doc: Chapter 5.2: Center of Excellence – Skills, Safety & Systemic Reform
coe_center_of_excellence.bom_file: 7. Integrator (Colubris Water Solutions)/technology/center of excellence/BOM V.1.0 5 aug.xlsx

iic_grant.note: Already correct in financing.json, needs display fix in Sources & Uses

p0_critical: Fix IIC grant display (€5k → €50k) in Sources & Uses
Fix all Balance Sheet gaps (debug DSRA, IC flows, depreciation)
TWX complete business model rewrite (3-phase evolution, EPCF wrapper)

NWL: Operations tab improvements (95% utilization label, CAS comparison, CoE container)
NWL: Facilities borders and 6-month DSRA periods

LanRED: 3-revenue model (IC+Smart City growth+open market), SA power crisis context
LanRED: Split PV/BESS assets, add price per kW from Bear benchmark
TWX: Pipeline graph, 3-phase explanation, CoE design docs references
cross_cutting: All Facilities: Borders, 6-month periods, Catalytic Assets logo
All Balance Sheets: Hero metrics improvement
All Sources & Uses: €50k IIC grant, list assets individually
